block.p: Lauren Elizabeth Eichler, the daughter of Anita and Stephen Eichler of Chevy Chase, Md., and Palm Beach Gardens, Fla., is to be married today to Jonathan Wener Berkun, the son of Flora Berkun and Rabbi Alvin K. Berkun of Pittsburgh. The bridegroom's father will perform the ceremony at Congregation Adas Israel in Washington.

The couple are students at the Jewish Theological Seminary of America in New York, where they met. They are also rabbinical interns, the bride at the National Jewish Center for Learning and Leadership in New York, and the bridegroom at the Aventura-Turnberry Jewish Center in Aventura, Fla.

Lauren Elizabeth Eichler, the daughter of Anita and Stephen Eichler of Chevy Chase, Md., and Palm Beach Gardens, Fla., is to be married today to Jonathan Wener Berkun, the son of Flora Berkun and Rabbi Alvin K. Berkun of Pittsburgh. The bridegroom's father will perform the ceremony at Congregation Adas Israel in Washington.

The couple are students at the Jewish Theological Seminary of America in New York, where they met. They are also rabbinical interns, the bride at the National Jewish Center for Learning and Leadership in New York, and the bridegroom at the Aventura-Turnberry Jewish Center in Aventura, Fla.

The bride, 28, graduated summa cum laude from Princeton University. Her mother works in Rockville, Md., as the associate administrator for alcohol policy at the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration of the Health and Human Services Department. Her father is the president of Eichler & Associates, a health-care investment company in Palm Beach Gardens.

The bridegroom, 27, graduated from Columbia and is a member of the Flatiron Five, a professional a capella singing group in New York. His father is the rabbi at Tree of Life Congregation in Pittsburgh.
